page.title: 04Farming In Norton Area.
page.content: {Crops. } We saw a field where a sugar beet demonstration had been held. The sugar beet is harvested and taken by lorry to Kidderminster factory from about October till February.Farmers are issued with permits which allow them to send a limited amount of beet to the factory each day. They can buy back sugar beet pulp, which they use for animal fodder. Potatoes are harvested in summer and autumn, most of them being sold directly to potato merchants. Extra local labour is used on the machines for planting and harvesting . Some fodder beet is grown for feeding to animals in the winter.
